title: Soviet minesweeper T-120
text:
T-120 was a <a href="minesweeper%20%28ship%29">minesweeper</a> of the <a href="Soviet%20Navy">Soviet Navy</a> during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> and the <a href="Cold%20War">Cold War</a>. She had originally been built as USS "Assail" (AM-147), an , for the <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>, but never saw active service in the U.S. Navy. Upon completion she was transferred to the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a> under <a href="Lend-Lease">Lend-Lease</a> as "T-120"; she was never returned to the United States. "T-120" was sunk by in the <a href="Kara%20Sea">Kara Sea</a> in September 1944. Because of the <a href="Cold%20War">Cold War</a>, the U.S. Navy was unaware of this fate and the vessel remained on the American <a href="Naval%20Vessel%20Register">Naval Vessel Register</a> until she was struck on 1 January 1983.
Career.
"Assail" was laid down on 1 November 1942 at <a href="Tampa%2C%20Florida">Tampa, Florida</a>, by the <a href="Tampa%20Shipbuilding">Tampa Shipbuilding</a> Co.; launched on 27 December 1942; sponsored by Miss M. T. Hicks; and completed on 5 October 1943. She was transferred to the <a href="Soviet%20Union">Soviet Union</a> on the day she was completed under the <a href="lend-lease">lend-lease</a> program, and she served the <a href="Soviet%20Navy">Soviet Navy</a> as T-120 until she was <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a>ed and sunk 24 September 1944 in the <a href="Kara%20Sea">Kara Sea</a> by German submarine .
Never returned, "Assail" was carried on the American <a href="Naval%20Vessel%20Register">Naval Vessel Register</a> as MSF-147 after 7 February 1955 until struck on 1 January 1983.
